data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is designed to be a quality-focused workout that emphasizes endurance, strength, and technique. We’ll be going through six rounds of rowing or skiing, followed by some box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement while keeping a steady pace. Let’s break it down step by step!


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the Row: Sit on the rower with your feet secured. Start with your knees bent and your shins vertical. Grab the handle with both hands, keeping your arms straight.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest while keeping your elbows tucked.
  • Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position.
  • For the Ski Erg: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the handles with both hands, keeping your arms straight.
  • Engage your core and pull the handles down towards your hips, using your legs and arms in a coordinated motion.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the movement.
  • Avoid overextending your back; maintain a neutral spine.
  • Use your legs to drive the movement, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If you’re new to rowing, consider reducing the time to 2:00 or using a lighter resistance on the Ski Erg.
  • Focus on technique rather than speed.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body onto the box.
  • Bring your other foot up to meet the first, standing tall at the top.
  • Step back down one foot at a time and repeat.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core to maintain balance.
  • Use your legs to power up, not your back.
  • Alternate legs for each rep or complete all reps on one leg before switching.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height.
  • If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a platform.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out. Place the kettlebell between your feet.
  • Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up along your body, leading with your elbows.
  • At the top, your elbows should be above the kettlebell, and then lower it back down to the starting position.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep the kettlebell close to your body throughout the movement.
  • Engage your lats to help pull the kettlebell up.
  • Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form.
  • If you’re new to this movement, consider doing kettlebell deadlifts instead.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended.
  • Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  • Lower yourself back down with control.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  • Avoid using momentum; focus on controlled movements.
  • Engage your core to prevent sagging in your hips.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder.
  • If rings are too challenging, substitute with inverted rows using a barbell or TRX straps.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 2:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 16/8 (or no weight)
  • Kettlebell: 16/8 kg
  • Ring Rows: 8 reps

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 20/12 (or light weight)
  • Kettlebell: 20/12 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 24/16 (or moderate weight)
  • Kettlebell: 24/16 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows.
  • Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if you need to take a breather, that’s perfectly okay!

    • Alright, team! Let’s get after it and have some fun while we work hard today! Remember, quality over quantity!

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder.
  • If rings are too challenging, substitute with inverted rows using a barbell or TRX straps.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 2:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 16/8 (or no weight)
  • Kettlebell: 16/8 kg
  • Ring Rows: 8 reps

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 20/12 (or light weight)
  • Kettlebell: 20/12 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 24/16 (or moderate weight)
  • Kettlebell: 24/16 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows.
  • Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if you need to take a breather, that’s perfectly okay!

    • Alright, team! Let’s get after it and have some fun while we work hard today! Remember, quality over quantity!

--- AI EXPLANATION --- ## Workout Overview Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is designed to be a quality-focused workout that emphasizes endurance, strength, and technique. We’ll be going through six rounds of rowing or skiing, followed by some box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement while keeping a steady pace. Let’s break it down step by step! ## Workout Components ### 1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00) - **Technique Steps:** - For the Row: Sit on the rower with your feet secured. Start with your knees bent and your shins vertical. Grab the handle with both hands, keeping your arms straight. - Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest while keeping your elbows tucked. - Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position. - For the Ski Erg: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the handles with both hands, keeping your arms straight. - Engage your core and pull the handles down towards your hips, using your legs and arms in a coordinated motion. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the movement. - Avoid overextending your back; maintain a neutral spine. - Use your legs to drive the movement, not just your arms. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you’re new to rowing, consider reducing the time to 2:00 or using a lighter resistance on the Ski Erg. - Focus on technique rather than speed. ### 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart. - Step up with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body onto the box. - Bring your other foot up to meet the first, standing tall at the top. - Step back down one foot at a time and repeat. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your chest up and engage your core to maintain balance. - Use your legs to power up, not your back. - Alternate legs for each rep or complete all reps on one leg before switching. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height. - If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a platform. ### 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out. Place the kettlebell between your feet. - Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands. - Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up along your body, leading with your elbows. - At the top, your elbows should be above the kettlebell, and then lower it back down to the starting position. - **Form Tips:** - Keep the kettlebell close to your body throughout the movement. - Engage your lats to help pull the kettlebell up. - Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form. - If you’re new to this movement, consider doing kettlebell deadlifts instead. ### 4. Ring Rows (10 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended. - Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight. - Pull your chest towards the rings by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together. - Lower yourself back down with control. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. - Avoid using momentum; focus on controlled movements. - Engage your core to prevent sagging in your hips. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder. - If rings are too challenging, substitute with inverted rows using a barbell or TRX straps. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - Row/Ski: 2:00 - Box Step-Ups: 16/8 (or no weight) - Kettlebell: 16/8 kg - Ring Rows: 8 reps - **Train:** - Row/Ski: 3:00 - Box Step-Ups: 20/12 (or light weight) - Kettlebell: 20/12 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps - **Compete:** - Row/Ski: 3:00 - Box Step-Ups: 24/16 (or moderate weight) - Kettlebell: 24/16 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps ### Strategy Advice - Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury. - Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows. - Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if you need to take a breather, that’s perfectly okay! Alright, team! Let’s get after it and have some fun while we work hard today! Remember, quality over quantity!
